name: Celtic Session
desc: This workshop will focus on learning an Irish jig. Topics include learning by ear as well as adding traditional ornamentation. This is an instrumental workshop, most suited for wind or stringed instruments capable of playing a single melody line.

name: Cherubs
desc: A fun place for toddlers and pre-schoolers to play and laugh while their parents do other workshops or just hang out with their kids and other parents.

name: Children's Choir
desc: A choir for children, aged 6-12.  Sing fun songs with your friends and see how much fun a choir can be!

name: Concert Band
desc: Instrumental music for woodwinds, brass & percussion â€“ bring your own instrument, and a music stand if you have one.

name: Mental Health Workshop (AM)
desc:
Discussion and insight with a mental health professional. Bring your questions about anxiety, depression, ADHD, self-harm, suicide, or any other mental health topics. Participate as much as you want, whatever works for you.

Last day will be booked individual appointments if you want private discussion.

The focus of the period 1 workshop will be teen/youth issues, but anyone can attend.

Supported in part by a bequest to The Presbyterian Church in Canada.

name: Camp Choir
desc: Four-part singing for campers of any musical ability. Music reading is not required.

name: Cherubs (continued)
desc: A fun place for toddlers and pre-schoolers to play and laugh while their parents do other workshops or just hang out with their kids and other parents.

name: Children's Games
desc: Games and outdoor activities taking advantage of what the site and staff have to offer.

name: Banjo
desc: This is a safe space for banjo players and enthusiasts to escape persecution and learn styles and techniques on a 5 string instrument.

name: Beginner Guitar
desc: Learn your first guitar songs along with chords and strumming patterns.

name: Crafts for Kids
desc:
Different crafts every day.

Children under the age of 7 need to be accompanied by an adult.

name: Mental Health Workshop (PM)
desc:
Discussion and insight with a mental health professional. Bring your questions about anxiety, depression, ADHD, self-harm, suicide, or any other mental health topics. Participate as much as you want, whatever works for you.

Last day will be booked individual appointments if you want private discussion.

The focus of the period 3 workshop will be parents and parenting, but anyone can attend.

Supported in part by a bequest to The Presbyterian Church in Canada.

name: Strings
desc: Dust off your violins, violas and cellos! This is a reading-based workshop for string ensemble. We will try to accommodate all ages and levels, but some playing and reading experience on your instrument is necessary. Feel free to bring music you'd like to play.

name: Swimming and Canoeing (2:15 start)
desc: Beach fun!

name: Adult Crafts - Pen & Ink
desc:
A few studies working towards a larger piece.  Some drawing experience required.
Pens and paper provided and available for purchase after the workshop.

name: Adult Crafts - Watercolour
desc:
Come play with watercolour. Learn some basic techniques and try a few easy projects.

Please bring: basic watercolour kit, larger round brush (size 10-14) with a good pointy tip, a small round (size 3 or 4) or a rigger brush, 2 containers for water, paper towel, 140lb watercolour paper, masking tape, a pallet or plastic lid for mixing paints, and a board on which to tape your project.

name: Advanced Choir
desc: Sing some challenging a cappella songs.

name: Beginner Recorder + Ukulele
leader: Sue Thompson + Taras Broadhead & Sharon Hiebert
desc: The goal of beginner ukulele is to have fun.  We'll learn a little musicianship while we're singing familiar songs and practicing a handful of the most common ukulele chords.  There will be one reggae tune.  No previous experience required.  Please bring a ukulele, but if you don't have one, we'll figure something out.  Workshops are only 30 minutes long.

name: Book Club
desc:
Young Adult/Dystopian: Scythe, by Neal Shusterman
Contemporary Fiction: Someone Else's Shoes, by Jojo Moyes
Indigenous and Canadian Voices: Five Little Indians, by Michelle Good
Historical Fiction: The Nightingale, by Kristin Hannah

name: Garage Band
desc: It might get loud.  Jam out to some songs and learn some skills along the way.

name: Nature Exploration
desc: Time and days may vary depending on the weather and activity.

name: Swimming and Canoeing
desc: Beach fun!

name: Youth Choir
desc: Sing some choral music with your friends.

name: Beginner Hand Bells
desc: An introduction to playing hand bells in a group.

name: Bible Study
desc: Daily discussion based on the theme for each day. This year, teen and adult bible study is combined.

name: Drama Improv
desc: Laughter is welcome!

name: Drum Circle
desc: Learn the basics of hand drumming. Bring your djembes and other drums if you have them.  If not, we have a few loaners.

name: Electric Guitar for Acoustic Players
desc: Learn how your Acoustic Guitar knowledge and skills translate and what's new.  You do not need to bring an electric guitar to the workshop.

name: Guitar Songs
desc:
Monday - Beatles play-and-sing-a-long
Tuesday - Band oriented deep dive on Full Force Gale by Van Morrison
Wednesday - Mystery songs
Thursday - Song sharing free for all

name: Kids' Camp Memories
desc: Scrapbooking and more!

name: Non-beginner Ukulele
desc: Take your ukulele playing to the next level!

name: Relaxation
desc: Take some time for yourself and enjoy guided relaxations.

name: Sport of the Day
desc: Sport, time, and place will be announced at lunch.

name: Swimming and Canoeing (ends 4:45)
desc: Beach fun!

name: Advanced Hand Bells
desc:
An exploration of ringing techniques, including shakes, damped and undamped malleting, marts, mart lifts, thumb damps, plucks, and singing bells.  Repertoire features sections that include changing metres, malleted and rung bells.

Experience reading music in a handbell choir, other ensemble or similar is required.
